title: Easeout Weekly #4
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
body:
![Get Started Building GraphQL APIs With Node](/images/uploads/graphql-pattern.jpg) [Get Started Building GraphQL APIs With Node](https://css-tricks.com/get-started-building-graphql-apis-with-node/) A great exploration of GraphQL including, writing a schema, resolving schema functions, and accessing an API using the GraphQL Playground user interface. [Read it](https://css-tricks.com/get-started-building-graphql-apis-with-node/) ➡️
![Super Mario 3 Animated CSS](/images/uploads/smario-css.png) [Pure CSS Super Mario 3 Powerup Selector](https://codepen.io/hailedev/pen/KKpovpb) Play around with the Super Mario 3 powerups - coded in pure CSS! [See it](https://codepen.io/hailedev/pen/KKpovpb) ➡️
![The Psychology of Color and Emotional Design](/images/uploads/brain-ux.jpg) [The Psychology of Color and Emotional Design](https://www.uxbooth.com/articles/the-psychology-of-color-and-emotional-design/) Color is just one of many factors that impact user emotion and motivation. It doesn’t exist in a proverbial vacuum, but it can be incredibly powerful when properly understood and applied. [Read it](https://www.uxbooth.com/articles/the-psychology-of-color-and-emotional-design/) ➡️
![Pure CSS Landscape - An Evening in Southwold](/images/uploads/purecss-image.png) [Pure CSS Landscape - An Evening in Southwold](https://codepen.io/ivorjetski/full/xxGYWQG) An amazing example for the power of pure CSS! [See it](https://codepen.io/ivorjetski/full/xxGYWQG) ➡️
![Consistent Backends and UX: What Can Go Wrong?](/images/uploads/ux-be-2.jpg) [Consistent Backends and UX: What Can Go Wrong?](https://css-tricks.com/consistent-backends-and-ux-what-can-go-wrong/) This articles examines how a lack of strong consistency makes it harder to deliver a good end-user experience, can bring serious engineering overhead, and could open you up to exploits. [Read it](https://css-tricks.com/consistent-backends-and-ux-what-can-go-wrong/) ➡️
![Programming Sass to Create Accessible Color Combinations](/images/uploads/contrast-colors.jpg) [Programming Sass to Create Accessible Color Combinations](https://css-tricks.com/programming-sass-to-create-accessible-color-combinations/) This article shows how we can implement a Sass function, that handles accessible color combinations in our designs. [Read it ](https://css-tricks.com/programming-sass-to-create-accessible-color-combinations/)➡️
![Fluid Width Video](/images/uploads/fluid-width-video.jpg) [Fluid Width Video](https://css-tricks.com/fluid-width-video/) A look at some of the methods we can use to create fluid width video. [Read it](https://css-tricks.com/fluid-width-video/) ➡️
![How to Make a Line Chart With CSS](/images/uploads/line-chart.png) [How to Make a Line Chart With CSS](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-line-chart-with-css/) If all you need is a simple line chart, there's no need to load in a huge JavaScript library or even reach for SVG. You can make everything you need with just CSS and a couple of custom properties in your HTML. [Read it](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-make-a-line-chart-with-css/) ➡️
![Creating Secure Password Flows With NodeJS And MySQL](/images/uploads/creating-secure-password-flows-nodejs-mysql.png) [Creating Secure Password Flows with NodeJS and MySQL](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/03/creating-secure-password-flows-nodejs-mysql/) Reset password functionality is table stakes for any user-friendly application. It can also be a security nightmare. Using NodeJS and MySQL, Darshan demonstrates how to successfully create a secure reset password flow so you can avoid these pitfalls. [Read it](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/03/creating-secure-password-flows-nodejs-mysql/) ➡️
![Considerations When Choosing Fonts for a Multilingual Website](/images/uploads/typography-multi.png) [Considerations When Choosing Fonts for a Multilingual Website](https://css-tricks.com/considerations-when-choosing-fonts-for-a-multilingual-website/) In this article, Omar Bourhaouta shows us how to deal with multilingual websites — especially cases where both right-to-left (RTL) and left-to-right (LTR) are used. [Read it](https://css-tricks.com/considerations-when-choosing-fonts-for-a-multilingual-website/) ➡️
![Building An E-Commerce Site With October CMS And Shopaholic](/images/uploads/october-cms.jpg) [Building An E-Commerce Site with October CMS and Shopaholic](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/03/october-cms-shopaholic/) The Laravel-powered October CMS enables to extend the functionality of the application through the use of plugins. In this article, we will learn how to create an e-commerce site through one of October’s most popular plugins, Shopaholic. [Read it](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/03/october-cms-shopaholic/)➡️
![Vacation To-Do List](/images/uploads/vacation-todo-list.png) [Vacation To-Do List](https://codepen.io/tjgill/details/gObKNZB) A lovely vanilla JS todo list by Taronjot Gill. [See it](https://codepen.io/tjgill/details/gObKNZB) ➡️
